title: Matthew Chapter 19 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 19 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 19 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 19.

questions.question: Where did Jesus go after finishing His sayings according to Matthew 19:1?
options: The coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan
questions.correctAnswer: The coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:1 states that Jesus departed from Galilee and came into the coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan.

questions.question: Who came to Jesus, tempting Him about the lawfulness of putting away a wife?
questions.correctAnswer: Pharisees
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:3 specifies that the Pharisees came to Jesus, tempting Him with a question about divorce.

questions.question: According to Matthew 19:6, what should not be done to what God has joined together?
questions.correctAnswer: Let not man put asunder
questions.explanation: Verse 19:6 says that what God has joined together, man should not separate.

questions.question: Why did Moses allow giving a writing of divorcement according to Jesus in Matthew 19:8?
options: Because of the hardness of your hearts
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the hardness of your hearts
questions.explanation: Jesus explained in Matthew 19:8 that Moses allowed divorce because of the hardness of people's hearts.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 19:9, putting away a wife except for fornication and marrying another is considered adultery.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:9 states that except for fornication, putting away a wife and marrying another is adultery.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Matthew 19:14: 'Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: kingdom of heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:14 records Jesus saying that the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as little children.

questions.question: What did the young man ask Jesus in Matthew 19:16?
options: What good thing shall I do to have eternal life?
questions.correctAnswer: What good thing shall I do to have eternal life?
questions.explanation: In Matthew 19:16, a young man asked Jesus what good thing he should do to have eternal life.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Matthew 19:17, who is truly good?
questions.correctAnswer: God only
questions.explanation: Jesus said in Matthew 19:17 that none is good but God alone.

questions.question: Which commandment is NOT mentioned in Jesus' response in Matthew 19:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt not covet
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:18 lists commandments including no murder, no adultery, no stealing, no false witness but does not mention coveting.

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the young man to do if he wanted to be perfect according to Matthew 19:21?
options: Sell what you have and give to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Sell what you have and give to the poor
questions.explanation: In Matthew 19:21, Jesus told the young man to sell his possessions, give to the poor, and follow Him to be perfect.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:24 records Jesus saying it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter God's kingdom.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the disciples when they heard about the difficulty for the rich to enter the kingdom of heaven?
questions.correctAnswer: They were exceedingly amazed
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:25 indicates the disciples were exceedingly amazed upon hearing Jesus' statement.

questions.question: Who said, 'Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed thee; what shall we have therefore?'
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:27 records Peter asking Jesus this question.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus promised those who have followed Him will sit upon twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:28 states that Jesus promised His followers they would sit on twelve thrones judging the tribes of Israel.

questions.question: According to Matthew 19:30, what is said about the first and the last?
options: The first shall be last; and the last shall be first
The first shall be greatest; the last shall be least
The first shall be honored; the last forgotten
The first shall lead; the last shall follow
questions.correctAnswer: The first shall be last; and the last shall be first
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:30 says many who are first will be last, and the last will be first.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 19 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 19 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Matthew 19 teach us about the sanctity of marriage?
options: Marriage is a sacred union joined by God and should not be broken by man.
Marriage is only a social contract and can be ended easily.
Divorce is always acceptable for any reason.
Marriage is optional and has no spiritual significance.
questions.correctAnswer: Marriage is a sacred union joined by God and should not be broken by man.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:4-6 highlights that God made male and female and joined them as one flesh, and that what God has joined together, man should not separate, emphasizing the sacredness of marriage.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with forgiveness in marriage after a spouse's unfaithfulness. According to Matthew 19, what guidance can you give about divorce?
options: Divorce is only allowed in cases of fornication.
Divorce is allowed for any reason.
Divorce is encouraged for personal happiness.
questions.correctAnswer: Divorce is only allowed in cases of fornication.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:9 teaches that divorce and remarriage constitute adultery except in the case of sexual immorality, showing God's allowance for forgiveness but also setting boundaries.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about children coming to Him, and what does this teach about welcoming others in faith?
options: Children should be allowed to come to Jesus, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as them.
Children should be kept away from Jesus until they are older.
Only adults are allowed to approach Jesus.
Jesus did not interact with children.
questions.correctAnswer: Children should be allowed to come to Jesus, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as them.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:14 shows Jesus welcoming children, teaching believers to be open and encouraging to all, especially the humble and innocent, in faith.

questions.question: How does Matthew 19 encourage believers to view wealth and possessions in relation to entering the kingdom of heaven?
options: Wealth can hinder entrance to the kingdom of heaven.
Rich people are always blessed more than poor people.
questions.correctAnswer: Wealth can hinder entrance to the kingdom of heaven.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:23-24 teaches that it is difficult for a rich person to enter heaven, likening it to a camel going through the eye of a needle, emphasizing the need for detachment from riches.

questions.question: When a young man asks Jesus what he must do to have eternal life, what does Jesus emphasize as essential?
options: Keeping the commandments and following Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the commandments and following Jesus.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:17 and 19:21 show Jesus telling the man to obey the commandments and then to sell his possessions, give to the poor, and follow Him, highlighting obedience and discipleship.

questions.question: What spiritual principle can be drawn from Jesus' response to the disciples about who can accept the teaching on marriage and celibacy?
options: Not all are able to accept certain teachings unless given grace to do so.
Everyone must accept all teachings immediately.
Celibacy is mandatory for all believers.
Teachings on marriage are optional and unimportant.
questions.correctAnswer: Not all are able to accept certain teachings unless given grace to do so.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:11-12 explains that only those to whom it is given can accept the teaching about eunuchs and celibacy, teaching humility and reliance on God's grace in spiritual matters.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus taught that to have eternal life one must keep commandments such as not committing adultery and loving one's neighbor.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Matthew 19:18-19, Jesus lists commandments including not murdering, not committing adultery, and loving one's neighbor as essential to entering life, underscoring obedience.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 19, Jesus rebuked the disciples for allowing children to come to Him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:13-14 shows the disciples rebuked the children, but Jesus corrected them and welcomed the children, emphasizing openness and humility in faith.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with materialism and wealth. Based on Matthew 19, what biblical truth would you share about treasures in heaven?
options: Selling possessions and giving to the poor leads to treasure in heaven.
Accumulating wealth is the primary goal for Christians.
We should hide our wealth to avoid giving it away.
Wealth has no connection to eternal reward.
questions.correctAnswer: Selling possessions and giving to the poor leads to treasure in heaven.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:21 teaches that selling possessions and giving to the poor results in treasures in heaven, encouraging generosity and stewardship.

questions.question: How does Matthew 19 illustrate the importance of humility and contentment in discipleship?
options: Many who are first shall be last, and the last shall be first.
Wealth and status guarantee God's favor.
Contentment is irrelevant in the kingdom of heaven.
questions.correctAnswer: Many who are first shall be last, and the last shall be first.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:30 shows Jesus teaching humility by reversing worldly status, encouraging believers to be humble and content in their place before God.

questions.question: According to Matthew 19, what is the role of faith and trust in God when facing challenges to salvation?
options: With God, all things are possible, even when men find it impossible.
Salvation depends solely on human effort.
God does not intervene in human salvation.
questions.correctAnswer: With God, all things are possible, even when men find it impossible.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:26 encourages believers to trust in God's power for salvation, recognizing human limitations and divine possibility.

questions.question: What promise does Jesus give to those who have forsaken family and possessions for His name's sake?
options: They will receive a hundredfold and inherit everlasting life.
They will lose everything without reward.
They will be forgotten and abandoned.
They will be rewarded only in this life.
questions.correctAnswer: They will receive a hundredfold and inherit everlasting life.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:29 promises great reward and eternal life for those who sacrifice for Christ, encouraging faithful discipleship and perseverance.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'If thou wilt be perfect, go and sell that thou hast, and give to the _____, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven.'
questions.correctAnswer: poor
questions.explanation: In Matthew 19:21, Jesus commands giving to the poor as an act of discipleship leading to heavenly treasure.

questions.question: How does Matthew 19 teach about the role of integrity and obedience in daily life?
options: Keeping God's commandments is essential to enter life.
Obedience is only symbolic, not practical.
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping God's commandments is essential to enter life.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:17 and 19:18 emphasize the necessity of obeying commandments such as not murdering, not stealing, and honoring parents as foundational to righteous living.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the role of disciples in judging Israel in the age to come?
options: They will sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
They will lead armies against Israel.
They will have no authority in the kingdom.
They will be forgotten in the future.
questions.correctAnswer: They will sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
questions.explanation: Matthew 19:28 records Jesus promising His followers authority in the regeneration, highlighting the reward and responsibility of discipleship.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 19 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 19.

questions.question: In Matthew 19:4-6, Jesus refers to the creation of male and female to explain the permanence of marriage. Which Old Testament book is He alluding to in this teaching?
questions.correctAnswer: Genesis
questions.explanation: Jesus references the creation account of man and woman as recorded in Genesis 1-2, emphasizing the original intent for marriage as one flesh (Matthew 19:4-6).

questions.question: According to Matthew 19:8, why did Moses allow the law of divorce?
options: Because of the hardness of the people's hearts
Because it was God's original plan
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the hardness of the people's hearts
questions.explanation: Jesus states that Moses permitted divorce due to the hardness of people's hearts, indicating it was a concession rather than the original divine intention (Matthew 19:8).

questions.question: What is the condition Jesus gives in Matthew 19:9 that permits divorce without committing adultery?
questions.correctAnswer: Fornication
questions.explanation: Jesus permits divorce only in the case of fornication, otherwise remarriage after divorce is considered adultery (Matthew 19:9).

questions.question: In Matthew 19:12, Jesus speaks about eunuchs. Which of the following is NOT one of the eunuch types He mentions?
options: Those born eunuchs from the mother's womb
Those who made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven
Those who refuse to marry out of ignorance
questions.correctAnswer: Those who refuse to marry out of ignorance
questions.explanation: Jesus categorizes eunuchs as those born so, made so by men, or who choose celibacy for the kingdom, but does not mention refusal to marry out of ignorance (Matthew 19:12).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about children in Matthew 19:14 that foreshadows the kingdom of heaven's nature?
options: The kingdom belongs to such as these
Children should be silent and obedient
Only adults can enter the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom belongs to such as these
questions.explanation: Jesus welcomes little children and declares the kingdom of heaven belongs to those like them, highlighting humility and innocence as kingdom values (Matthew 19:14).

questions.question: In response to the rich young man, Jesus lists commandments in Matthew 19:18-19. Which commandment is NOT included in His list?
options: Thou shalt not take the Lord's name in vain
Honour thy father and thy mother
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt not take the Lord's name in vain
questions.explanation: Jesus omits the commandment about not taking God's name in vain, focusing on commandments about murder, adultery, theft, false witness, honoring parents, and loving neighbors (Matthew 19:18-19).

questions.question: What does Jesus instruct the rich young man to do in order to be perfect, according to Matthew 19:21?
options: Sell all he has, give to the poor, and follow Jesus
Build a house for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Sell all he has, give to the poor, and follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Jesus calls the young man to relinquish his wealth, give to the poor, and follow Him to attain perfection (Matthew 19:21).

questions.question: Which metaphor does Jesus use in Matthew 19:24 to illustrate the difficulty for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven?
options: A camel going through the eye of a needle
A lion entering a sheep pen
A mountain moving to the sea
questions.correctAnswer: A camel going through the eye of a needle
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the hyperbolic metaphor of a camel passing through the eye of a needle to emphasize the near impossibility for rich individuals to enter God's kingdom without divine help (Matthew 19:24).

questions.question: How do the disciples respond to Jesus' teaching about the difficulty of salvation for the rich, as recorded in Matthew 19:25?
options: They are exceedingly amazed and ask who can be saved
They immediately give up their possessions
questions.correctAnswer: They are exceedingly amazed and ask who can be saved
questions.explanation: The disciples express astonishment and question who then can be saved if salvation is so difficult for the rich (Matthew 19:25).

questions.question: What is Jesus' answer to the disciples' question about salvation in Matthew 19:26?
options: With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible
We must earn salvation through works
questions.correctAnswer: With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible
questions.explanation: Jesus affirms that human effort alone cannot achieve salvation, but God's power makes all things possible (Matthew 19:26).

questions.question: In Matthew 19:28, Jesus promises that those who have followed Him will sit upon how many thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve thrones
questions.explanation: Jesus states His followers will sit on twelve thrones to judge the twelve tribes, indicating authority in the eschatological kingdom (Matthew 19:28).

questions.question: According to Matthew 19:29, what reward is promised to those who forsake possessions and family for Jesus' name?
questions.correctAnswer: A hundredfold and everlasting life
questions.explanation: Jesus promises a hundredfold return and eternal life for those who sacrifice for His name (Matthew 19:29).

questions.question: What literary device is most evident in Jesus’ statement in Matthew 19:30, 'But many that are first shall be last; and the last shall be first'?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: The statement is a chiasm, a literary structure where ideas are mirrored in reverse order, emphasizing reversal of status in God's kingdom (Matthew 19:30).

questions.question: True or False: In Matthew 19:17, Jesus acknowledges God as the only one who is truly good.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus states there is none good but one, that is God, affirming God's unique goodness (Matthew 19:17).

questions.question: What cultural practice is challenged by Jesus’ teachings on divorce in Matthew 19, considering Jewish traditions of the time?
options: The permissive divorce laws allowing dismissal for trivial reasons
Polygamy accepted in some Jewish circles
The practice of sending children to the temple school
questions.correctAnswer: The permissive divorce laws allowing dismissal for trivial reasons
questions.explanation: Jesus challenges Pharisaic interpretations that allowed men to divorce wives for any reason, emphasizing the original creation intent for marriage permanence (Matthew 19:3-9).

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 19 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 19 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Matthew 19, what is the divine reason marriage unites a man and a woman?
options: For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife
Because marriage is a social contract approved by Moses
To increase the population of Israel
So that the husband may have authority over his wife
questions.correctAnswer: For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife
questions.explanation: Jesus quotes Genesis 2:24 emphasizing the theological foundation of marriage as a divine union where man leaves his parents and cleaves to his wife, becoming one flesh (Matthew 19:5-6). This reflects God's original design (Genesis 2:24, Mark 10:7-8, Ephesians 5:31).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about divorce and remarriage except in the case of fornication?
options: It is a matter of personal conscience
questions.correctAnswer: It constitutes adultery
questions.explanation: Jesus clarifies that divorcing a wife except for sexual immorality and marrying another is adultery, upholding the sanctity of marriage and condemning unjustified divorce (Matthew 19:9). This is consistent with Malachi 2:16, Mark 10:11-12, and 1 Corinthians 7:10-11.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the difficulty for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven?
options: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle
It is impossible for a rich man
It depends on how generous he is
It is easier than for a poor man
questions.correctAnswer: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle
questions.explanation: Jesus uses a metaphor illustrating the extreme difficulty for the wealthy to enter God's kingdom, emphasizing reliance on divine grace (Matthew 19:24). This aligns with Luke 18:25 and Mark 10:25, highlighting human insufficiency and God's power (Ephesians 2:8-9).

questions.question: What is Jesus’ response when asked what good thing one must do to have eternal life?
options: Give all possessions to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Keep the commandments
questions.explanation: Jesus directs the questioner to obey God's commandments as the path to eternal life (Matthew 19:17), consistent with the Torah's moral law (Exodus 20, Deuteronomy 5) and Jesus' teaching in John 14:15 and Romans 13:10.

questions.question: How did the young man respond when Jesus told him to sell all he had and give to the poor?
options: He asked for time to think
questions.correctAnswer: He went away sorrowful
questions.explanation: The young man’s sorrow reflects the challenge of surrendering earthly possessions for the kingdom (Matthew 19:22), paralleling the rich ruler in Mark 10:22 and Luke 18:23, showing the heart’s attachment to wealth can hinder salvation.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about those who have forsaken family and possessions for His name's sake?
options: They shall receive a hundredfold and inherit eternal life
They will be forgotten by God
They will be rewarded only in this life
questions.correctAnswer: They shall receive a hundredfold and inherit eternal life
questions.explanation: Jesus promises abundant blessing and eternal inheritance for those who sacrifice for the gospel (Matthew 19:29), consistent with promises in Mark 10:29-30, Luke 18:29-30, and Hebrews 11:6.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe those who are able to receive the teaching on celibacy?
options: Only those to whom it is given
Anyone who desires can receive it
questions.correctAnswer: Only those to whom it is given
questions.explanation: Jesus explains that celibacy is a special calling granted by God (Matthew 19:11-12), highlighting divine sovereignty in spiritual gifts (1 Corinthians 7:7, Romans 12:6), and the voluntary nature of this gift.

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give for Moses permitting divorce in the Old Testament?
options: Because of the hardness of people's hearts
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the hardness of people's hearts
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that Moses allowed divorce due to human stubbornness, not God's original intent (Matthew 19:8), consistent with Jeremiah 3:8 and Hosea 4:17, emphasizing God's ideal of faithful covenant.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about little children coming to Him?
options: The kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these
They should be kept away until older
They are not important in the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these
questions.explanation: Jesus welcomes children, affirming their value and humility as models for entering God's kingdom (Matthew 19:14), reflecting themes in Mark 10:14 and Luke 18:16, and teaching about childlike faith (Psalm 8:2).

questions.question: What did Peter ask Jesus regarding those who have left everything to follow Him?
options: Will we be rulers on earth?
questions.correctAnswer: What shall we have therefore?
questions.explanation: Peter inquires about the reward for discipleship (Matthew 19:27), anticipating the eschatological reward Jesus later describes (Matthew 19:28-29), consistent with Luke 22:28-30 and Revelation 3:21.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the judgment role of His followers in the regeneration?
options: They will sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel
They will have no role in judgment
questions.correctAnswer: They will sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel
questions.explanation: Jesus promises His faithful followers an authoritative role judging Israel in the eschatological renewal (Matthew 19:28), consistent with 1 Corinthians 6:2-3 and Revelation 20:4.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the first and the last in the kingdom of heaven?
options: Many that are first shall be last; and the last shall be first
The first shall always be first
questions.correctAnswer: Many that are first shall be last; and the last shall be first
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches a reversal of worldly values in God's kingdom (Matthew 19:30), a theme echoed in Mark 10:31, Luke 13:30, and James 2:5, emphasizing humility and grace over status.

questions.question: What is Jesus’ reply to the disciples' amazement about who can be saved?
options: With men it is impossible; but with God all things are possible
Only the righteous can be saved
Only the rich can be saved
questions.correctAnswer: With men it is impossible; but with God all things are possible
questions.explanation: Jesus affirms salvation is solely by God's power, not human merit (Matthew 19:26), consistent with John 6:44, Ephesians 2:8-9, and Philippians 4:13, highlighting divine sovereignty and grace.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about those who marry a woman divorced for reasons other than fornication?
questions.correctAnswer: They commit adultery
questions.explanation: Jesus states that marrying a woman divorced for reasons other than sexual immorality is adultery (Matthew 19:9), reinforcing the sanctity of marriage and covenant faithfulness (Malachi 2:14-16, Romans 7:2-3).

questions.question: Which group did Jesus say some eunuchs are who have made themselves eunuchs?
options: For the kingdom of heaven's sake
questions.correctAnswer: For the kingdom of heaven's sake
questions.explanation: Jesus acknowledges voluntary celibacy for the sake of the kingdom (Matthew 19:12), recognizing self-sacrifice in devotion to God's mission (cf. 1 Corinthians 7:32-35, Isaiah 56:4-5).
